context_evidences: - The image used with the false quote shows Trump during a 1988 appearance on “The Oprah Winfrey Show” where he discussed running for president, but made no reference to Republicans being “the dumbest group of voters.” Reference: https://apnews.com/article/archive-fact-checking-5466940186 published on 2019-06-03 19:23:52

- People’s magazine archive shows Trump did appear in the publication in the 1990s, but the coverage was mostly centered on his personal relationships ( here , here , here ). On September 2, 1987, shortly after releasing a full-page newspaper ad criticizing U.S. foreign policy, Trump identified himself as a Republican during an interview with CNN’S Larry King ( youtu.be/A8wJc7vHcTs?t=24 ). Trump also explicitly told King that he had no interest in running for president ( youtu.be/A8wJc7vHcTs?t=297 ). Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-factcheck-trump-republicans-meme/fact-check-trump-did-not-call-republicans-the-dumbest-group-of-voters-idUSKBN2342S5 published on 2020-05-28 16:09:30

- In December 1987, People published a profile on Donald Trump titled “Too Darn Rich”. The article quoted him saying he was too busy to run for president ( here ). Most iterations of the meme feature a photo of Trump during an interview on The Oprah Winfrey Show in 1988, when he said he would probably not run for president but wouldn’t rule it out ( youtu.be/SEPs17_AkTI?t=55 ). Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-factcheck-trump-republicans-meme/fact-check-trump-did-not-call-republicans-the-dumbest-group-of-voters-idUSKBN2342S5 published on 2020-05-28 16:09:30

- The quote first began circulating in 2015 and has been widely shared across social media platforms, including Facebook. It has been widely debunked since that time. Reference: https://apnews.com/article/archive-fact-checking-5466940186 published on 2019-06-03 19:23:52
correction_response:
This tweet is misinformed. The quote attributed to Donald Trump in the attached image is false. He did not make such a comment to People magazine in 1998. This has been confirmed by both AP and Reuters, as well as by People magazine itself. The quote first began circulating in 2015 and has been debunked multiple times since then. Please refer to these sources for more information: 
https://apnews.com/article/archive-fact-checking-5466940186
https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-factcheck-trump-republicans-meme/fact-check-trump-did-not-call-republicans-the-dumbest-group-of-voters-idUSKBN2342S5
note_1_text: This tweet contains a previously debunked quote attributed to Donald Trump. This was never said by him.    https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/republicans-dumbest-group-of-voters/
note_2_text: While I wish it was true that he said that, he didn’t say it. Facts matter.    https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/republicans-dumbest-group-of-voters/
queries:
1. "Donald Trump quote about Republicans in People Magazine 1998"
2. "Did Donald Trump call Republicans the dumbest group of voters"
3. "Donald Trump's statements about Fox News"
4. "Donald Trump's political affiliation in 1998"
5. "Donald Trump's views on Republican voters"
refute_evidences: - AP’S ASSESSMENT: False. The president did not make such a comment to People magazine. Reference: https://apnews.com/article/archive-fact-checking-5466940186 published on 2019-06-03 19:23:52

- The meme reads: “If I were to run, I’d run as a Republican. They’re the dumbest group of voters in the country. They believe anything on Fox News. I could lie and they’d still eat it up. I bet my numbers would be terrific. - Donald Trump, People Magazine, 1998” Snopes first wrote about the false quote here in October 2015 . Since then, the quote has been debunked multiple times ( here , here , here ). Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-factcheck-trump-republicans-meme/fact-check-trump-did-not-call-republicans-the-dumbest-group-of-voters-idUSKBN2342S5 published on 2020-05-28 16:09:30

- People magazine has confirmed in the past that its archive has no register of this alleged exchange. “People looked into this exhaustively when it first surfaced back in Oct. (2015). We combed through every Trump story in our archive. We couldn’t find anything remotely like this quote–and no interview at all in 1998.”, a magazine spokesperson told Factcheck.org that year ( here ). Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-factcheck-trump-republicans-meme/fact-check-trump-did-not-call-republicans-the-dumbest-group-of-voters-idUSKBN2342S5 published on 2020-05-28 16:09:30

- Julie Farin, a People magazine spokeswoman, told The Associated Press that the magazine looked into the claim exhaustively when it first surfaced years ago but did not find anything remotely like it made by the president. Reference: https://apnews.com/article/archive-fact-checking-5466940186 published on 2019-06-03 19:23:52
tweet_image2text: A quote from Donald Trump, "If I were to run, I'd run as a Republican. They're the dumbest group of voters in the country. They believe anything on Fox News. I could lie and they'd still eat it up. I bet my numbers would be terrific." This quote was originally from People Magazine, 1998, and was shared by Other98.
